key_risks: Regulatory uncertainty due to delays in FDA approval and potential hurdles in international markets
Market competition from established products like EpiPen and Auvi-Q
Manufacturing and supply chain risks due to dependence on third-party manufacturers
Adoption challenges in convincing healthcare providers and patients to switch from traditional auto-injectors
controversies: Delays in FDA approval process raised concerns about commercialization timelines
Potential skepticism about the efficacy of a nasal spray compared to traditional auto-injectors
social_issues: Patient access and safety concerns addressed by needle-free design and inclusion in Express Scripts formularies
